intro: Diporidium wallichii var. longifolium, commonly known as the long-leaved diporidium, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan regions of India and Nepal. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
